title: Sarah Jessica Parker and Rebecca Judd talk parenting as star reveals how she keeps her kids grounded
text:
She's famous around the globe for her role as Carrie Bradshaw in Sex And The City.

Now, Sarah Jessica Parker has revealed how she keeps her three children grounded while discussing parenting with AFL WAG Rebecca Judd.

Appearing on Rebecca's KIIS FM radio show the 3pm Pickup on Tuesday, Sarah explained she wants her twins Marion and Tabitha, 10, and son James, 16, to work hard for their dreams.

Staying humble: Sarah Jessica Parker has revealed how she keeps her three children grounded while discussing parenting with AFL WAG Rebecca Judd. Sara is pictured centre with her twin daughters Marion (left) and Tabitha (right)

Asked how she keeps her children humble despite their New York City upbringing, Sarah said they've only known her as a mother, rather than a world-famous actress.

She said: 'Parents who aren't well known can have children who aren't grounded because of the example set in their home.'

The Sex and the City star went on to credit country legend Dolly Parton for imparting some parenting words of wisdom.

Keep them grounded: Asked how she keeps her children humble despite their celebrity upbringing, Sarah said they've only known her as a mother, rather than a world-famous actress. Sarah is pictured with her husband, Matthew Broderick

The singer, who came from humble beginnings in America, said that after finding fame she vowed to only give her family what they need - rather than what they want.

Sarah told Rebecca and her co-host Katie 'Monty' Dimond that this was now the motto she tries to live by as she raises her three children.

She said: 'I will do my best to make sure you always have what you need, but I want you pining towards something.

Set the example: Sarah said the key was to set an example of 'working hard'. Mother of four Rebecca Judd (pictured right) is married to former Australian rules footballer Chris Judd (left)

'I want you to work for something, to dream of it, to will it to happen.'

Mother of four Rebecca agreed with the sentiment.

'Working hard for it, experiencing disappointment, makes it so good when you pull it off,' she replied.

Sarah, 54, and her husband Matthew Broderick, 57, welcomed their son James in 2002, before having the twins via a surrogate seven years later.

She appeared on the KIIS FM show while in Australia to launch her new shoe brand SJP in department store David Jones.
